HOMEMADE TURKEY BREAKFAST SAUSAGE PATTIES

Skip the store-bought sausage and make your own! These lean turkey sausage patties are seasoned perfectly and have 22g protein per serving with minimal fat.

22g
Protein
140
Calories
22m
Total Time
12
Yield

Nutrition per 2 patties

Carbs1g
Fat7g
Fiber0g
Sugar0g
Sodium380mg
DifficultyEasy

MEAL PREP INFO

Batch Size

12 servings

Storage

Fridge: 5 days
Freezer: 3 months

Reheat Options

Microwave: 45-60 seconds ...
Stovetop: 2-3 min per side ...

INGREDIENTS

  • 680g (1.5 lbs) 93% lean ground turkey
  • 10g maple syrup (or sugar-free alternative)
  • 5g dried sage
  • 3g dried thyme
  • 3g fennel seeds, crushed
  • 3g smoked paprika
  • 2g garlic powder
  • 2g onion powder
  • 1g black pepper
  • 5g salt
  • Pinch of cayenne (optional)

INSTRUCTIONS

1

Mix Seasonings

In a small bowl, combine all spices and maple syrup.

2

Season Meat

Add ground turkey to a large bowl. Pour spice mixture over turkey and mix with hands until evenly distributed. Don't overmix.

3

Form Patties

Divide into 12 equal portions. Form into thin patties about 3 inches in diameter.

4

Cook

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties 5-6 minutes per side until internal temp reaches 165F.

5

Store

Cool completely before storing. Layer with parchment paper in airtight container.
